intro: Ebenus abyssinica, commonly known as Abyssinian thornapple, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and showy, violet or purple flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Ebenus abyssinica is also noted for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
